name: Computing Systems & Hardware
description: Sector template for computing systems patents including memory management, interconnects, and hardware architecture.
contextDescription: Computing systems patents cover the hardware and low-level software of computing platforms. Key areas include memory management (G06F12*), bus/interconnect (G06F13*), memory controllers, cache systems, and system architecture. High-value targets include Intel, AMD, ARM, Qualcomm, and memory vendors like Samsung, SK Hynix, Micron.
scoringGuidance: Memory management patents (caching, virtual memory, TLB) are essential to all processors.
Interconnect/bus patents apply to chip-to-chip and system-level communication.
Hardware architecture patents may be standards-essential (DDR, PCIe, CXL).
Consider both desktop/server and mobile/embedded implementations.
Cache coherency and memory consistency patents are fundamental to multicore systems.

questions.question: Does this patent require hardware implementation? Score: 1-3 for pure software, 4-6 for hardware-optional, 7-10 for hardware-required.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Hardware patents often have higher damages due to per-unit royalties on chip sales.

questions.question: How relevant is this patent to memory subsystems (cache, DRAM, controllers, virtual memory)?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Memory is a bottleneck in all systems. Assess memory subsystem impact.

questions.question: Does this patent apply to processor/SoC design? Consider Intel, AMD, ARM, Apple, Qualcomm implementations.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Processor vendors are high-value targets. Identify processor applicability.

questions.question: Does this patent relate to interconnects, buses, or data paths (PCIe, CXL, DDR, on-chip networks)?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Interconnect patents may be standards-essential. Identify bus/interconnect technologies.
